page.title: 02The Church Kingsbury.
page.content: A church was built on the site of the present church by the Saxons in about 900. A stone one was first built in 1300AD.That is the nave of the church now.The tower is particularly interesting.It is called a Quantock tower,as it has three sections separated by horizontal lines of quatrefoils.On the side of the tower are several shields,one of which is that of Catherine Lambroc,who provided the money for the building of the tower about 1460.The name Lambrook survives in the names of several local villages.Episcopi in the name of the village shows that the land locally was owned by the Bishop of Bath and Wells.A group of us went to the top of the tower one morning.To the north we could see the flat fields of Westmoor,to the west,Burrow Hill, and below the roofs of the village.
